intro: Niphobolus assimilis, commonly known as the white-flowered false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are pollinated by insects. The plant contains various bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine and phytochemistry research.
